title: LAIR ORB / dark celebration 2
description: An afterthought to Ruby's scene whether she kills herself or runs away -- exists outside Ruby by Rosemary as redundancy

dialogueTree.title: Horrific Necktie: "*Bratan*, now is the time!"

links.title: You: "Time for what?"
links.text: Time for what?

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Oh... you will see. (It feels like..."
links.text: Oh... you will see. (It feels like the tie is rubbing itself against your chest like a cat in heat.)

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "First, the spirits -- the blue medi..."
links.text: First, the spirits -- the blue medicinal spirits. Grab the bottle and uncork it! It is time to unleash the Other-World.

links.title: You: "Wait, right now? A woman just died..."
links.text: Wait, right now? A woman just died and you think now is a good time to party?

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "*Bratan*, life and death are insepa..."
links.text: *Bratan*, life and death are inseparable. There's a party when you're born, a party every year to celebrate that birth, and a party when you're put in the ground.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Yeah... what's the problem here?"
links.text: Yeah... what's the problem here?

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Why shouldn't there be a party when..."
links.text: Why shouldn't there be a party when you die? And, beside, this isn't even about that! You have no idea what this is about... this is gonna be so off the hook. It's gonna be off *all* hooks.

links.title: You: "Wait, right now? Ruby's gone. I don..."
links.text: Wait, right now? Ruby's gone. I don't really think there's anything to celebrate here.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Hush-hush, *bratan*, now is not the..."
links.text: Hush-hush, *bratan*, now is not the time to celebrate, now is the time to get *ready*. Trust me on this. This is what it's all been building towards. It's gonna be off the hook. Off *all* hooks.

links.title: You: "Slowly uncork the blue medicinal sp..."
links.text: Slowly uncork the blue medicinal spirit.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "The bottle opens with a silent, mys..."
links.text: The bottle opens with a silent, mysterious hiss. The fumes rising from its mouth are as crisp as the northern winds.

links.title: Shivers: "Howling somewhere, lashing the boar..."
links.text: Howling somewhere, lashing the boardwalk with brine and rain -- an ancient warmth crawls under your skin.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Now, *bratan*, take me off."
links.text: Now, *bratan*, take me off.

links.title: You: "What? I didn't know I could do that..."
links.text: What? I didn't know I could do that...

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "*Bratan*, have I ever lied to you?..."
links.text: *Bratan*, have I ever lied to you? Just take me off. (The necktie tugs encouragingly at your neck.)

links.title: You: "Take the necktie off."
links.text: Take the necktie off.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Your fingers manage to undo the oil..."
links.text: Your fingers manage to undo the oily knot and the necktie slides off. It looks so frail sitting there in your hand, weighing almost nothing.

links.title: You: "Now what?"
links.text: Now what?

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Now put me in the bottle."
links.text: Now put me in the bottle.

links.title: You: "But... why?"
links.text: But... why?

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Trust me -- just trust me. You and..."
links.text: Trust me -- just trust me. You and I are going to have so much fun it should be illegal!

links.title: You: "I suspect that it might be."
links.text: I suspect that it might be.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Just put me in the bottle, *bratan*..."
links.text: Just put me in the bottle, *bratan*. I'm not gonna let you down. You and I are, like, the same person.

links.title: You: "But that's *too much fun*."
links.text: But that's *too much fun*.

links.title: You: "Put the necktie tie in the bottle."
links.text: Put the necktie tie in the bottle.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "As the necktie slides into the puri..."
links.text: As the necktie slides into the purifying liquid, large stains of grease rise off from it and float to the surface. There they quickly dissolve and disappear completely.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Cleansed by the blue spirit-fire of..."
links.text: Cleansed by the blue spirit-fire of 98.7% pure alcohol, the fabric looks almost new again. No longer like a disgusting worm of the lower intestine, but like a colourful and deadly poisonous reef-snake of the Insulindian ocean.

links.title: You: "So... what next?"
links.text: So... what next?

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "The necktie floats in the blueish l..."
links.text: The necktie floats in the blueish liquid with almost unearthly grace.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It's like an organic sample brought..."
links.text: It's like an organic sample brought back from a distant star system inhabited by sentient neckwear.

links.title: You: "Necktie?"
links.text: Necktie?

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "There is silence."
links.text: There is silence.

links.title: You: "Cork the bottle and put it away."
links.text: Cork the bottle and put it away.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant has been observing y..."
links.text: The lieutenant has been observing you quietly all this time.

links.title: Empathy: "He's struggling to keep silent, but..."
links.text: He's struggling to keep silent, but finally seems to give up.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I've got to ask..." he says, a pec..."
links.text: "I've got to ask..." he says, a peculiar look in his eyes. "What are you doing?"

links.title: Drama: "As always -- lie."
links.text: As always -- lie.

links.title: You: ""I don't really know, but I'm eager..."
links.text: "I don't really know, but I'm eager to find out."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That makes two of us." He shakes h..."
links.text: "That makes two of us." He shakes his head slowly. "Let's not waste any more time under this boardwalk. We need to clear this all up... somehow."

links.title: You: ""In my family when someone dies you..."
links.text: "In my family when someone dies you put a piece of clothing in a bottle as a sign of eternal respect."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That makes absolutely no sense." H..."
links.text: "That makes absolutely no sense." He thinks for a moment. "But I guess every family has its own traditions."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let us not linger. We have a great..."
links.text: "Let us not linger. We have a great big mess to figure out." He turns to face the road ahead.

links.title: You: ""In my family, you put a piece of c..."
links.text: "In my family, you put a piece of clothing in some hard liquor and drink it for good luck. It's silly, but no harm done, right?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No harm? In drinking 98.7% alcohol..."
links.text: "No harm? In drinking 98.7% alcohol with a god-knows-how-old tie in it? I wouldn't be so sure." The lieutenant tilts his head slightly. "However, I'm not here to judge. Let's go."

links.title: You: ""Okay, Kim... I didn't want to tell..."
links.text: "Okay, Kim... I didn't want to tell anyone, but my necktie has been talking to me lately."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course it has." He doesn't even..."
links.text: "Of course it has." He doesn't even look too surprised.

links.title: You: ""It started when I woke up in the W..."
links.text: "It started when I woke up in the Whirling-in-Rags. It's been talking to me ever since."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And what has the necktie been tell..."
links.text: "And what has the necktie been telling you, if I may ask?"

links.title: You: ""It mostly urges me to party harder.""
links.text: "It mostly urges me to party harder."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wonderful. Very useful.""
links.text: "Wonderful. Very useful."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He doesn't actually believe it's wo..."
links.text: He doesn't actually believe it's wonderful.

links.title: You: ""It teaches me about life, Kim. Sor..."
links.text: "It teaches me about life, Kim. Sort of a father figure."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay. So why did you put it in the..."
links.text: "Okay. So why did you put it in the bottle?"

links.title: You: ""Why not, lieutenant?""
links.text: "Why not, lieutenant?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Right. Okay. Anyway, I'm glad you..."
links.text: "Right. Okay. Anyway, I'm glad you told me your necktie has been speaking to you. That must not have been easy." For a second it looks like he's about to add something...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "We're all under stress. This is tur..."
links.text: We're all under stress. This is turning into a great big mess. I'm not judging. Just keep it together.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "...but then he turns away -- his ga..."
links.text: ...but then he turns away -- his gaze fixed on the road ahead. "Let's go," he concludes.

links.title: You: ""Because it told me to.""
links.text: "Because it told me to."

links.title: You: ""I simply don't know.""
links.text: "I simply don't know."

links.title: You: ""We're buds. Mostly just goofing ar..."
links.text: "We're buds. Mostly just goofing around."

links.title: You: ""Signs of some really hard core men..."
links.text: "Signs of some really hard core mental illness, Kim." (Point to your head.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I would assume, yes. Why did you p..."
links.text: "I would assume, yes. Why did you put it in the bottle?"

links.title: You: ""Forget it, you're not *open-minded..."
links.text: "Forget it, you're not *open-minded* enough to understand anyway."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A relationship between a man and a..."
links.text: "A relationship between a man and a talking necktie? No, apparently I am not." His voice rings of insincere sadness as he turns to leave.

links.title: You: ""Mind your own business, binoclard!""
links.text: "Mind your own business, binoclard!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Alright." The lieutenant's face st..."
links.text: "Alright." The lieutenant's face stiffens as he turns to look at the road ahead. "I won't ask again."

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Feels good. Feels safe."
links.text: Feels good. Feels safe.

links.title: You: "Begone, foul necktie! Finally I rid..."
links.text: Begone, foul necktie! Finally I rid myself of you! (End it. Throw the necktie as far as you can.)

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "The oily rag flaps miserably in the..."
links.text: The oily rag flaps miserably in the air and lands close by in the dirt. It looks like an inanimate object, completely devoid of life.

links.title: Inland Empire: "It was just trying to help...."
links.text: It was just trying to help....

links.title: You: "You know what, I'm done with this c..."
links.text: You know what, I'm done with this crazy talking necktie bullshit!

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "But, *bratan*... no. Please uncork..."
links.text: But, *bratan*... no. Please uncork it. I can make it good again.

links.title: You: "Go away necktie. You're just a figm..."
links.text: Go away necktie. You're just a figment of my imagination.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "*Bratan*, don't push me away. I wan..."
links.text: *Bratan*, don't push me away. I want to be there for you. Also -- how can you be sure *you* are not just a figment of *my* imagination?

links.title: You: "Okay, then tell me -- it is time fo..."
links.text: Okay, then tell me -- it is time for what?

links.title: You: "Get lost, necktie! I don't want to..."
links.text: Get lost, necktie! I don't want to be your friend.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "But, *bratan*... I... I understand...."
links.text: But, *bratan*... I... I understand. (The tie loosens around your neck.) I just wanted you to have fun. I... I never meant to be a burden.

links.title: You: "Necktie... I'm sorry. I didn't mean..."
links.text: Necktie... I'm sorry. I didn't mean it like that.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "No, *bratan*, no need for that. You..."
links.text: No, *bratan*, no need for that. You and I are *bratannoi* -- brothers. Brothers fight. But when they're done fighting, you know what they do? They party. They fucking party!

links.title: You: "Necktie, you and I are done. Both p..."
links.text: Necktie, you and I are done. Both professionally -- and as friends. Begone! (End the tie.)

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "The lifeless necktie looks like a c..."
links.text: The lifeless necktie looks like a colourful intestine of some dead animal: oily, alien and otherwise disgusting. What could have driven a man to wear something so repulsive around his neck?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Seems you'll never learn the answer..."
links.text: Seems you'll never learn the answer to that question.
